intro: Humboltia cabellensis, commonly known as the Peruvian datura, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces large, spiny fruits that contain toxic seeds, making it a member of the deadly nightshade group. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
